newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: DUTCH BUSINESS CONFIDENCE FALLS IN MARCH.
newsitem.headline: DUTCH BUSINESS CONFIDENCE FALLS IN MARCH.

text.p: Dutch business
confidence index fell to 3.2 in March from February, the Central
Bureau of Statistics (CBS) said.
DUTCH BUSINESS CONFIDENCE INDEX (No base date)
Mar 97 Feb 97 Mar 96
The business confidence index is derived from the monthly
CBS survey among Dutch manufacturers and is intended to provide
a reliable picture of how Dutch manufacturing production will
develop in the coming four to five months.
The index is calculated from manufacturers' answers to three
questions about the expected level of business activity in the
coming three months, the level of orders on their books and the
level of their stocks of finished products.
Starting with the February data, the CBS has recalculated
the index according to a new method, making it directly
comparable to its consumer confidence indicator.
The data is adjusted for structurally recurring distortions
and seasonal influences and the final figure is calculated as
the mathematical average of the three component series.
The index has no base date.
Providers of professional services expect turnover and
employment to further improve in the second quarter, the CBS
said.
The CBS said that -- despite a slightly lower indicator for
industrial entrepreneurs -- these entrepeneurs were still
optimistic, as business confidence has been above the average
level of 1995 and 1996 since December 1996.
